creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
first off thanks to JMeter developers. I get "out of memory" errors when I run a 
test with the following settings:

threads: 15
ramp-up: 5
iterations: 300
size of html file: 26384 bytes
memory setting: %JAVA%\java -Xmx95m .....

Once out of memory error occurs, the GUI locks up and does not respond. This 
system doesn't have much memory, so I set the maximum. For html pages that are 
smaller, the test runs to completion. I'm guessing if I had half a gig of memory 
and set the minimum memory to say 128mb and max to like 256mb, I probably 
wouldn't see the memory error. Once I am done with my tests, I am planning on 
looking at the source to find out the cause. if I find the problem, I will 
submit a patch.

thanks again.

peter lin

I suspect the cause is use a one of the visualizers that extends 
ResultCollector.  View Results Visualizer is an example.  I will submit a mod 
to this soon to fix the problem.  If it's caused by something else, I'd surely 
like to know.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
Made changes to alleviate most out of memory errors.  If it still occurs for 
anyone, please reopen this bug, and list all the listeners you are using in 
your tests.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

text:
Marking all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8's release date as VERIFIED.
Yes, it's pretty poor QA procedure, but there's bugs here lingering since JMeter
1.6, and we need to clean up a little.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com

text: Bulk-closing all bugs RESOLVED before JMeter 1.8 release date.
creator: jsalvata@atg.com

text:
I'm getting an java.lang.OutOfMemoryError when I try to run the HTTP Proxy
Server. It worked for 1-2 days and then suddently it stopped recording
activities and show this error. I'm using the View Results In Tree and View
Results In Table listeners. I tried removing some of them but I'm still getting
this error. Rebooting didn't helped either. I got 256 mo of RAM and extended to
512 in virtual memory. And I'm not sure if it's cause by this error, but it
seems that the test plans aren't saved anymore. I have to change back the values
of every form each time I reopen the .jmx file. I'll see if I can't find a way
around this for now.

Thanks
Jonathan
creator: jracicot@solabs.com

text:
If I start a new Test Plan, the proxy starts working again and saves the
incoming pages.
creator: jracicot@solabs.com

text:
Is this because your test plan gets so big JMeter runs out of memory?  Your last
comment seems to suggest that. In the latest code, this shouldn't be a problem,
because memory for test plans has been greatly decreased (very substantially).

Reopen if is still a problem with latest code.
creator: mstover1@apache.org
